title: Flipped Learning-Based Simulation Education for Ophthalmic Practice Management Competency Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of ophthalmic conditions and medical management experience
context.additional_context: Combines smartphone-based VR simulations with flipped learning to enable effective learning in resource-constrained technological environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain diagnostic processes for three common ocular diseases (glaucoma, cataracts, and diabetic retinopathy) through VR simulation
After flipped learning activities, learners can present problem-solving strategies with 80% accuracy through ophthalmic patient case analysis
In team-based project assessments, learners can collaboratively develop and present protocols for handling ophthalmic emergency situations

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
